Reviews.Title: “Believe All Reviews and Avoid”
Reviews.Author: KeithB05
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews. But weâ€™ve traveled all over the world and stayed in lots of sketchy places in some pretty out-of-the way towns. We figured that this couldnâ€™t be that bad. We needed to be in this vicinity to be close to some relatives. Unfortunately, since it was the week between Christmas and New Years, most places were booked. So we broke down and decided that it would be OK. Now the place isnâ€™t horrible, but just so sad. And it isnâ€™t cheap. The place was probably something pretty nice in 1970. Unfortunately, it doesnâ€™t look like anything has been done for the place since then. Nothing in the rooms works right and the one horrible staff person around had no means or interest in making anything better. Also, we were the only people there, so it all felt abandoned. We should have stayed further away in San Juan or Fajardo and driven back and forth. Learn from my mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Look before you leap”
Reviews.Author: infoispower
Reviews.Content: When cleaning out some old files, I came across my internet research for Rio Grande Plantation. When we were there in early 2000, and it was empty except for me and my husband. The first room they gave us must have been the worst room they had. Mildew all over the walls, filthy toilet, etc. When I went to the office to speak to the owner, she said pretended not to speak English. Fortunately, I am fluent in Spanish, so I complained about the room and asked for my money back. (We had made advance reservations, believing the web site!) She refused, and said "take it or leave it." I said, "Fine. We'll drive back to San Juan and I'll find the tourist agency and let them know what has happened." She then said she would give us a cleaner room. We were taken to a room that had no mildew; it was on an upper floor, not at ground level. Much better. There was a huge pool which looked ok, but it had a small household size device for cleaning which circled around and around. We decided not to risk the pool due to fear of infection. During our three day visit, no one else checked in. There was no food service and the hotel is down a two-lane winding road which is very dark at night, so we had to be sure to eat before we returned for the evening. I was astonished to see the review which said that this is a top notch facility. The grounds are very beautiful, and it is remote and natural. I would hesitate, however, to come here with children or anyone who is not in good health. You have to fend for yourself, and the mold/moisture problems are a concern. Frankly, I was surprised to see that the place was still in business. If you are planning to stay here, there's no need to make reservations or to give credit card information. Go see it to determine if it is what you want, because once they have your money you may not get it back. Not to worry if you change your mind; several hotels on the main road. This is not the only place to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gem in rainforest, will bring the kids next time.”
Reviews.Author: sparky6915
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here and will come back with our 4 kids. This is a hidden gem in the rainforest, a former sugar cane plantation located on a rushing mountain river (there is also a small stream with a footbridge) with large pavillions with skirted tables suitable for entertaining large groups. We saw two old carriages that must have been used for tours or something of the many acres of the plantation. The humidity creates a perfect environment for moss, beautiful ferns as tall as our second floor room, flowering trees and vines. I don't know how the owners keep it up. As we walked by the pretty, large and clean pool (there is a smaller unused one by the office/owners home-do not judge by this first impression) a very slight breeze came and a shower of nuts and leaves fell into the pool and onto the walk. The pool was clean, so they must have to sweep constantly. The resort was like stepping back in time, the environment is jungley, as expected in the rainforest. We loved hearing the tiny coqui frogs in the evening, and it surprised us that most of them went to sleep for the night later. We have stayed at many 4 and 5 start resorts and this was no problem for us; state of the art many years ago and a very refreshing experience -a charming phone booth with lights still glowing down by the pool does not work. Where do you even see phone booths anymore? The tv in the room didn't either, but the one in the lobby had comfortable couches, and did work. We did not come to Puerto Rico to watch tv anyway, and had our books. We knew in advance that the outdoor restaurant had suffered from the down economy and the beautiful covered silver serving dishes sit unused on the buffet. We met the chef as we were checking in, he had to find another job but were told by the owner that he is like family and still lives onsite. We bought our hot dinner from the deli at Ralph's Food Warehouse (or named something like that) a nearby grocery store on highway 3 and brought that and some fruit for breakfast to the hotel with us. They have bottled water and pop and beer for a small fee in the lobby, but be sure to get it before the owners turn in for the night as the cooler is locked. There is a refrigerator and microwave, as well as a coffee maker with a pouch of Puerto Rican coffee in the room. The shower was hot, the beds comfortable and the sound of the rushing river was a delight. It is safe, there is an automatic gate at the entrance to the grounds and we were given a remote so we could come and go at our leisure. Cell reception is very spotty in the mountains, so we left once in the early evening to call our kids. Please tell your friends about this place so that this widow and son can afford to make some repairs to the grounds and buildings, this is a large jewel created by a man with vision that deserves to be preserved. We ate breakfast at Don Pepe's on hwy 3 and highly recommend it. El Yunque (the national rainforest) is very close and we drove up there the following day to see the beautiful waterfalls.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: dem219
Reviews.Content: Simply horrible. We were the only people there, literally! There were no other guests, and there was no staff in the evening. There was no food service, at all. Our room was small and dirty with mildew. The grounds were dilapidated. The hotel was in a terrible location, remote and far from El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “Unplug at RIo Grande”
Reviews.Author: dinizgm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into Rio Grande for two nights so we could take in some hiking in El Yunque. Advertised as at the foot of the El Yunque rainforest, Rio Grande is situated on the opposite side of El Yunque from the park entrance, so requires about a 20 minute drive to the park's trails. The stay is bare-bones, but pleasant. We found the room to be very dark - with very little lighting provided - but the service was decent and our stay was quiet. The sounds of the coqui and other night wildlife easily drown out cars passing on the nearby road, but can keep you awake at night if you are a sensitive sleeper. We probably would not stay here again, but thought it was an interesting experience in a beautiful natural setting. The low cost and setting would make this a nice stay for families, but not as much for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay a dime until you tour this place.”
Reviews.Author: moose302
Reviews.Content: The web site makes this place seem vibrant, clean and full of activities. We arrived to find a resort that was in an advanced state of disrepair and deserted. The rooms were dirty and the circulating pump for a once-beautiful pool was sitting on the side of the deck pumping water into the air. Unfortunately, before our visit when I had asked to hold a room, they charged my credit card the full amount and they so far have refused a refund. If you want to check this spot out, be sure you do not give credit card information. You will have no problem getting a room on a walk-in basis. We paid the full amount and walked away without staying.

Reviews.Title: “Better than El Yunque!!!”
Reviews.Author: gurugar
Reviews.Content: Rio Grande Plantation is a jewel. We had just come from a week on Culebra so we were relaxed and peaceful. The drive from Fajardo to the Rio Grande Plantation was culture shock with traffic jams, loud music blaring, and tons of people. Rio Grande Plantation took us back to the peacefulness of Culebra...only at the rain forest instead of the beach. The owners are so gentle and accommodating. Hotels.com had botched our reservation and had us arriving at a different date. We were lucky there was even a room available. The one room open was one of the more expensive "outside" rooms and our reservations were for the less expensive "inside" rooms. The owners gave us the expensive room for the less expensive fee. BTW, don't do the inside rooms. The outside rooms are worth the extra. The rooms are great and the facilities mostly 4 star quality. Remember, you are adjacent to the rain forest. There are frogs, turtles, birds, and tons of plants. Don't get freaked out if the pool, as fantastic as it is, has a few leaves in it in the morning. Let the frogs serenade you to sleep, take a midnight dip in the pool, walk through the grounds, and enjoy the rain forest. We had two teenagers with us so you know they need activities. Rio Grande has the great pool and they have an outside covered activity room with two pool tables and two ping pong tables. There are arcade games as well, but they were unplugged and didn't look like they worked. That brings up the realization that this hotel/convention center was once a huge enterprise run by the current owner's father. They have outside covered pavilions with the potential to host hundreds of day visitors . I don't think that is occurring now so the hotel guests have this huge facility to ourselves. It offers private walks through the trees and bamboo, watch the turtles, and photograph the flowers. I'd suggest calling the hotel directly to ensure your reservation and to speak with the owners. They are good people and are working hard to keep this facility top notch. We are definitely returning.

Reviews.Title: “DON"T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaxx25
Reviews.Content: This place may have been nice 20 years ago, but nothing has been updated since. Everything was rusty, the fixtures, the pool. The place was deserted! We did not see another guest the entire time and it took 30 minutes to find an employee. The cable didn't work, the restaurant was abandoned. I suggest finding something else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously....don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MPM_chicago
Reviews.Content: We found this property listed in several travel books including Fodors and "off the beaten path". It sounds too good to be true and it is. We were the only ones staying in this "resort". The second bathroom shower didn't work, the fans didn't work, the rooms had an outdated appearance. The pool was ok but the pump didn't work. The game room was a graveyard for broken video games. We came somewhat late in the day and thought it might be nice to have dinner there...they charged 30 dollars a person for rice, beans and chicken! Rumor is that the property is in bankruptcy and they are waiting for someone to buy them out. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre/ twighlight zone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived during heavy rain in the mid-afternoon and made our way to the registration building. Oddly, the lights were on but NO ONE was to be seen anywhere. We waited a bit in the registration lobby and were surprised to see a large mouse walk by us twice. After waiting and not seeing anyone OR seeing a sign of what the procedure to find someone was, we began walking around the property. There appeared to be several very large banquet rooms and terraces for large events as well as a very large pool area. As we walked, we still saw NO ONE!! It looked like the place was deserted. In the lodge building there was what looked like a registration desk, but no one was there. There are not many rooms. As we walked through the tile floored lodge, all of the room doors were open, and it appeared that no one was staying there. We finally located a phone and called "0". After some difficulty getting someone, we were asked to wait. We were then finally checked into one of the smaller rooms with no view to speak of. It was clean and modern. Staying there was somewhat eerie; we were the only guests in the place. We looked in some of the other rooms (doors open all night), and some of them were quite large with kitchens, semi-private balconies, and/or several bedrooms. Very secluded location. Buildings somewhat rough around the edges. Not worth the high price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: pjxak
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place close to El Yunque and booked here from Old San Juan. It has potential but the whole place is in need of attention. We booked a 2-bed 2-bath suite for four. We were the only ones booked at the place! I guess that should have told us something. The toilet didn't work but, luckily, there was someone to fix it. When we later took showers before going to dinner, we discovered that one of the bathrooms had no hot water. We looked around for someone to help us with this and there was no one to be found. The next morning when we checked out we told the clerk and asked for a discount. We thought it would be fair to pay for a 1-bath place which was $50 less. The clerk told us she couldn't approve this and the manager wasn't there to be able to approve this either. We were not able to hang around for the manager. Not happy... Don't stay there. Basically, it's a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Eco-Resort very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wntrnmane
Reviews.Content: Described as a special treat, a bit of luxury, but was in fact a sadly neglected, decaying bunch of buildings surrounding a lovely large swimming pool. If only they could attend to the entire place the way they do the pool. The 'villas' reminded me of cheap, rundown hotel rooms, with rickety rusted railings and bathroom fixtures. Electric outlets that didn't work, a shower that leaked through the wall into the entry way, decrepit, cheap mass produced appliances and furniture.... Though the staff were wonderful, they were quite scarce. This was terribly upsetting when we couldn't find a phone that worked, or access to a computer with internet hookup, and my sister's husband is in Iraq. At $250/night I expected better.

HotelInfo.Name: Rio Grande Plantation Eco Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Road No 956, Guzman Abajo, Km. 4, Hm 2, Rio Grande 00745, Puerto Rico
